name: ostd::arch::cpu::context::CpuExceptionType
doc_adt:
As Osdev Wiki defines(<https://wiki.osdev.org/Exceptions>):
 CPU exceptions are classified as:

 Faults: These can be corrected and the program may continue as if nothing happened.

 Traps: Traps are reported immediately after the execution of the trapping instruction.

 Aborts: Some severe unrecoverable error.

 But there exists some vector which are special. Vector 1 can be both fault or trap and vector 2 is interrupt.
 So here we also define FaultOrTrap and Interrupt

VariantIdx(Some(0))-FieldIdx(None).name: Fault
VariantIdx(Some(0))-FieldIdx(None).doc: CPU faults. Faults can be corrected, and the program may continue as if nothing happened.

VariantIdx(Some(1))-FieldIdx(None).name: Trap
VariantIdx(Some(1))-FieldIdx(None).doc: CPU traps. Traps are reported immediately after the execution of the trapping instruction
